Key Arguments: The bill grants excessive power to ACMA to decide what constitutes misinformation and disinformation, potentially limiting free speech.
The legislation exempts mainstream media and the government from the same scrutiny, creating a double standard.
Individuals should have the right to seek, discuss, and impart information freely without fear of reprisal.
The bill could lead to self-censorship and stifle open discussion and debate.
The responsibility for determining misinformation should not rest with digital platforms or ACMA employees.
Main Themes: Individual rights to information and opinion
Notable Quotes: It is expressly against my will that this billâ€™s be introduced.
I believe everyone should have the right to hold and express their opinions freely.

Are digital platforms, mainstream media and the government the only groups allowed to express an opinion as fact while the population of Australia is robbed of its opinions and expressions of thought?
I desire that I can investigate all views in relation to my life and make my own decisions after intelligent consideration.
